Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the number of Ohio Turnpike workers getting paid $66,000 a year to collect tolls.
Understate: The claim may be understating the number of toll collectors who make big money from overtime work.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support to prove that there are Ohio Turnpike workers getting paid $66,000 a year to collect tolls.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that machines can effectively replace all toll collectors, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the governor's intention to target toll collectors, such as budget constraints or efficiency concerns.
